title: 5 Ways to Increase Weight Loss on Wegovy
meta_description: Want to increase weight loss on Wegovy? Click to learn proven strategies - from nutrition & exercise to sleep & lifestyle changes - for maximum results.

h1: How to increase weight loss on Wegovy?
h2: Key takeaways:
1. Eat balanced meals on Wegovy
2. Exercise to enhance Wegovy’s effectiveness
3. Don’t forget to hydrate
4. Sleep well to lose weight on Wegovy
5. Don’t stress yourself while on Wegovy
To conclude
FAQs
h3: Here’s how you can do that:
Here’s what you can do for better hydration:
Here’s how to stay away from stress:
Visit your doctor in case of the following:

paragraphs: We have sent a passcode to above number. Please enter your code.
“Do I really need to change my lifestyle on Wegovy, or will the medicine do all the work?”
Yes, Wegovy can help you lose weight. But if you're hoping for long-term results, you need something more powerful than the medication - you.
The real game-changer.
This guide focuses on making small, manageable changes, such as eating healthily, walking more, or learning to stop eating when you feel full.
If you’re just getting started with Wegovy (or wondering how to achieve better results), here are a 5 best lifestyle changes that can make a difference.

Even if your appetite has reduced, your food choices still play a big role in how your body responds. Taking Wegovy doesn't mean giving up on your favourite foods. You just need to make simple changes.
The trick here is to focus on your hunger cues rather than eating out of habit or schedule.
We know that staying physically active is always a positive for our overall health.

Studies[1] have shown that combining Wegovy with regular exercise leads to greater weight loss, reduces belly fat, and improves blood sugar, blood pressure, and energy levels better than using Wegovy or exercise alone.
Experts recommend doing up to five hours of moderate-intensity exercise[2] every week.
Staying hydrated is a simple yet very underrated way to reduce side effects and improve your results with Wegovy.
Drinking water helps:
Hydrating yourself well can help you minimise nausea, which is a common Wegovy side effect. Learn more about managing Wegovy side effects.
You can burn calories throughout the day by engaging in calorie-restricted exercise. However, rest and recovery also play a significant role in weight loss.
According to a study,[3] poor-quality sleep can lead to increased fat gain and muscle loss.
In times of stress, it is easy to turn to food for comfort. Sweets, fried snacks, or mindless munching can undo all your hard work.
That’s because stress pushes up your cortisol levels[4], a hormone that makes your body crave high-fat, high-sugar foods.
Feeling tempted to grab that sweet cookie? Your cravings might be a sign of a deeper issue. Learn how to control your food cravings and stay on track.
Important note
Wegovy is a prescription medication, and your doctor plays a crucial role in your success with it. Here’s when you should check in with your doctor:
Following up with your doctor regularly ensures that your body is responding to the medication as expected.

Weight loss medications like Wegovy are like tools that assist weight loss. But it is your habits that will keep the momentum going. Your food choices, exercise, and self-care are more important than anything in achieving weight loss success.
Making lifestyle changes doesn"t have to be a solo mission.
Get your family involved, whether it's for evening walks, cooking together, or simply supporting your choices.
So be patient with your body. Give your habits time to settle. And if things feel slow, that’s okay. Rome wasn’t built in a day.
Learn more about Wegovy
Can I drink alcohol while taking Wegovy?
Although there’s no known chemical interaction between Wegovy and alcohol, doctors generally recommend limiting or avoiding alcohol intake.
Alcohol tends to dehydrate, which can add to Wegovy's side effects like nausea, dizziness, headache, or fatigue.
Will Wegovy still work if I don’t exercise?
Yes, Wegovy will still be effective even if you don’t exercise.
However, incorporating gentle movements, such as walking or yoga, may help enhance fat loss and improve muscle tone.
Do I need to count calories on Wegovy?
It is not necessary to count calories if you’re taking Wegovy.
Calorie-counting is a good way to track your food intake and stay consistent. The key is to eat a healthy diet and maintain a healthy calorie deficit.
So, if counting makes you anxious, just stick to eating only helpful calories, not the empty ones.
Can I follow an intermittent fasting regimen while taking Wegovy?
Yes, you can. Several Wegovy users find it easier to practice intermittent fasting routines since their hunger is naturally lower.
How do I manage constipation on Wegovy?
To manage constipation, you need a healthy balance of fluids, fibre, and physical activity.
To achieve this, you can increase your water intake and set timely reminders to stay hydrated. Some users find that chia seeds or psyllium husk help.

Yogasanas like pavanamuktasana (wind-relieving pose), halasana (plough pose), ardha matsyendrasana (half spinal twist), bhujangasana (cobra pose), balasana (child’s pose), and malasana (garland pose) can make your bowels regular.
Does Wegovy also cause muscle loss?
Yes, your muscle mass may reduce if your protein intake or resistance training is low.
Workouts like strength training, along with adequate protein intake, help preserve muscle.
You can consult a nutritionist to set a protein intake that suits your body type.
Can I go out to eat while on Wegovy?
Yes, you can. But do so in moderation. Be cautious when selecting options cooked in healthy oils and eat them in small portions.
Should I avoid carbs altogether on Wegovy?
Unfortunately, carbs often receive a bad reputation for contributing to weight gain. On the contrary, they are healthy and a good source of energy.
The decision to take them or stop them should be made after you consult your doctor and nutritionist.
Balanced carbs from fruits, whole grains, and vegetables are fine in moderation.
Can I eat fatty foods while taking Wegovy?
Yes, but it"s best to go easy on very greasy or high-fat meals.
Fatty foods can worsen side effects like nausea, bloating, or indigestion in some people on Wegovy.
Healthy fats such as nuts, seeds, ghee, dahi, and groundnut oil are beneficial in moderate amounts.
What happens if I stop taking Wegovy after losing weight?
There is a possibility of regaining weight after you stop taking Wegovy.
But if you continue with the lifestyle changes made during the treatment, you can prevent this from happening.
Why am I not losing weight on Wegovy yet?
If you have just started taking Wegovy, it may take some time to see results.
The reasons could be:
Keep in touch with your doctor, and stay consistent.
Can I take Wegovy if I’m a vegetarian or a vegan?
Yes, you can. Just be sure that your diet contains adequate protein, fibre, and vitamin B12 so you lose weight and gain muscle.

title: Wegovy Dose Schedule for Weight Loss
meta_description: Starting Wegovy? Follow the Wegovy dose schedule, learn how to increase the dose safely each week, and know what to do if you miss a dose.

h1: Wegovy dosage guide for weight loss
h2: Key takeaways:
What is Wegovy? How does it work?
Wegovy dosage chart: A step-by-step guide to understanding the dose schedule
How do doctors decide which dose is right for you?
What to do if you miss a dose?
Managing side effects as your dose increases
Tips to make dose escalation easier
When to pause or reduce your Wegovy dose?
Weight loss at your dose, your pace
FAQs

paragraphs: We have sent a passcode to above number. Please enter your code.
You are planning to start Wegovy for weight loss.
But not sure how the dosage schedule works?
Let us help you out.
Wegovy is available in five different doses. But, why is that?
Titrating, adjusting the dose, too quickly can result in intense side effects and might make you discontinue the medicine.
This guide will help you understand how the Wegovy dosage schedule works, why going slow is better, and when (or if) it’s time to move up.

Developed by Novo Nordisk, Wegovy is a once-weekly injection designed to help you lose weight. Its active ingredient, Semaglutide[1], mimics the action of GLP-1, a naturally occurring hormone, which plays an important part in controlling appetite and managing insulin levels.
What this means is:

Wegovy was approved in India in June 2025 for chronic weight management in people who are overweight or obese. Unlike daily pills or strict diets, it’s taken as a once-weekly injection, which makes it more manageable for many people.
Like Wegovy, another medication known as Mounjaro works by mimicking not just GLP-1, but also GIP for better results. See how Mounjaro helps you lose weight.
You will begin taking Wegovy at its lowest dosage - 0.25 mg.
Your dosage will be increased every month.
This gradual increase helps your body adjust to the medicine.
As you progress, your doctor will decide how long to keep you on a particular dose based on how well you are doing.
Here is a typical dosing schedule doctors usually follow:
Please note that the actual plan may vary based on your doctor's advice.
Here’s what you can expect to see in the coming weeks when you start taking Wegovy:
Although 2.4 mg is the maximum dose for Wegovy, many respond well at a lower dose. Your dose may be maintained or escalated based on clinical results and your comfort level.
Your weight isn't the only factor that decides how much Wegovy you need. When prescribing Wegovy, doctors also evaluate the following things:
The reason behind doing so is to find the lowest effective dose so that you can lose weight without feeling worse. Some people stay on a lower dose long-term, and that’s perfectly okay.
In case you miss your dose, do the following:
Less than 2 days (48 hours) away:
Don't take the missed dose. Take your next dose on your regular scheduled day. Do not take a double dose to make up for the lost one.
More than 2 days (48 hours) away:
Take the missed dose as soon as you remember.
More than 2 weeks (14 days) have passed:
Wait for your usual injection day, or check with your doctor before restarting. They’ll guide you on whether to continue or adjust your schedule.
In case you need to change your injection day, make sure there’s a gap of at least two days between doses.
Since Wegovy works by altering your gut hormones, appetite, and insulin response, it can cause some unwanted effects.
Nausea, diarrhoea, constipation, and vomiting are among the most common side effects of Wegovy.
You’ll likely feel side effects of Wegovy early on or when your dose increases. But most of them are mild and disappear with time as your body adjusts to the medicine
It can take some time to get used to a medication, especially one that affects your appetite and blood sugar levels. But with these small changes, you can adapt to the new dose better:
Your doctor may advise to pause, delay, or reduce your Wegovy dose in the following situations:
If you’re unsure about a side effect, missed a dose, or are planning surgery, fasting, or pregnancy, talk to your doctor first before you make a decision.
Use a diary or a tracking app to record your daily weight, mood, energy levels, and any symptoms you experience. These records can help your doctor adjust your dose.

Everyone experiences weight loss differently. Some people see visible weight loss at a lower dose, while others may need to use the highest dose of Wegovy. What's important is that your body tolerates the dose safely and shows results.
With the right support and a little patience, you can see progress beyond the weighing scale.
Launched in India in June 2025
Wegovy is available in India in the form of a pre-filled injection pen (FlexTouch). You can either self-inject it or take it with the help of a healthcare professional.
Can I increase my Wegovy dose faster if I'm not experiencing any side effects?

Even if you feel completely fine, don’t skip ahead. Each 4-week stage is designed to help your body’s GLP-1 receptors adapt slowly and safely. Rushing doses can trigger sudden side effects or reduce how well the treatment works later.
Will I regain weight if I stop Wegovy after reaching my goal?

Yes, there is a risk of weight regain[2] if lifestyle habits aren’t in place. But with the right guidance, gradual dose reduction, and adequate lifestyle + diet changes, it’s absolutely possible to maintain your progress, even without staying on the highest dose forever.
Can my doctor customize my dose schedule differently from the standard plan?
Yes. The standard Wegovy dosage schedule is a general guideline. It is flexible to an extent, and your doctor may adjust it based on your current health and how your body responds to the medication.

For instance, someone might remain at 0.5 mg for 8 weeks, while another patient may stabilise at 1.0 mg for maintenance. Trust your doctor’s judgment. They’ll adjust your dose to keep it both safe and effective for you.
What if I feel nothing after the first few doses of Wegovy?

Don’t worry, this is normal. The initial 0.25 mg and 0.5 mg doses are meant to help your body adjust. Most people notice effects like appetite control or weight loss from 1.0 mg onwards. Your doctor will guide the pace.
Why do side effects come back each time I increase the dose?

This is completely normal. With every dose increase, your body is introduced to a higher level of Semaglutide, so it needs time to settle again. It’s common to experience mild nausea, bloating, or changes in your bowel habits for 3-10 days before they subside.
These symptoms tend to settle on their own as your body gets used to the new level. That’s exactly why the dose increases are spaced out to help you adapt gradually
I'm losing weight well on 1.0 mg. Do I still need to increase to higher doses?

Not always. If you’re losing weight steadily, tolerating the 1.0 mg dose well, and are happy with your progress, your doctor might choose to keep you there. The idea is to find the smallest dose that still helps you progress.
Can I go back to a lower dose if the side effects become too uncomfortable?
Yes, it’s possible. If you experience ongoing nausea, vomiting, or other strong side effects after moving up to a higher dose, your doctor might bring you back to a lower dose for a few more weeks.
Sometimes, staying at a lower dose for some weeks helps your body adjust before switching to a higher dose. And for some people, that’s the right long-term dose.
Just don’t adjust your dose on your own. Always check with your doctor first.
Why does the schedule require 4 weeks at each dose level? Can this timing be adjusted?

The 4-week gap is there for a reason. It lets your body adjust to the new dose and prevents side effects. Still, it’s not a one-size-fits-all rule. If you're struggling with side effects, your doctor may keep you at the same dose for 6–8 weeks instead.
I've missed 3 weeks of Wegovy. Do I need to restart from 0.25 mg?

Not always. Resuming your previous dose can be slightly tricky. After a gap of more than two weeks, your body loses some of its tolerance to the medicine. Your doctor will usually restart you at a slightly lower dose, and bring you back up to a higher dose gradually.
The ramp-up will be quicker this time, but still under your doctor’s supervision. Never restart on your own.
What should I do if I accidentally inject a higher dose than prescribed?
If this happens, even if you don't feel any symptoms right now, let your doctor know immediately.
Accidentally injecting a higher dose, such as 1.0mg instead of 0.5mg, can trigger intense nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, or low blood sugar.
Keep monitoring how you feel, and don’t take your next scheduled dose until your doctor advises. They’ll guide you on the safest way to restart.
Can I stay on the starting dose of 0.25 mg if I see good results?
Though 0.25 mg is technically a treatment dose, it is intended as a starting point to help you adjust. It keeps side effects low while your system learns to handle the medicine.
If you’re already seeing results on 0.25 mg, that’s good, but the progress may not last. Your doctor will likely guide you to increase the dose gradually so you get better results.
My weight loss has plateaued at my current dose. Should I ask my doctor to increase the dose?
Not necessarily. Weight loss plateaus are common and happen for a few reasons:
Before increasing your dose, your doctor will look at:
In many cases, small lifestyle adjustments work better than dose changes. Your doctor will guide you based on your current health status.
Do all patients have to reach the maintenance dose of Wegovy?

Not necessarily. While 2.4 mg is the full maintenance dose, not everyone may need to take it. Some people may see good results at a lower dose (this is especially true if they experience side effects at higher levels). Your doctor will help you find the dose that works best for your body.

Wegovy has revolutionised the science of weight loss. But is the once-weekly weight loss injection really worth the hype? Does it help maintain weight loss in the long run? Does it come with adverse side effects? Scroll down to find the answers.
Who knew that one day, we could just take an injection and lose weight? Our great-great-great ancestors, who had to stay active just to eat and survive, would probably flinch at the thought.

But let us admit it - we have now found Wegovy, a new way to eliminate obesity. This weight loss injection has arrived just in time, as obesity is becoming one of the topmost causes of disease and death around the world. With a sedentary lifestyle such as ours, where we do not have the time to follow a strict diet or exercise well, a weight loss injection is an absolute boon for mankind.
But what is this weight loss injection? How does it work? Does it really help lose weight and maintain that weight loss?
Read on to find out.

Wegovy is a once-weekly injection used for weight loss and weight management. Its active ingredient is semaglutide, a GLP-1 mimicking ingredient that the FDA approved in 2021. Novo Nordisk, a Danish pharmaceutical manufacturer, manufactures Wegovy. Apart from Wegovy, Novo Nordisk also manufactures the anti-diabetic drugs Ozempic and Rybelsus, which are made from semaglutide, the same active ingredient as Wegovy.
Wegovy’s active ingredient, semaglutide, works by mimicking a hormone in your body called GLP-1 (glucagon-like peptide-1). This is what GLP-1 hormone does in your body:
GLP-1 hormone signals the pancreas to release insulin when blood sugar is high. It helps move sugar into cells for energy.
The hormone slows down the movement of food through your stomach, making you feel full for longer after eating.
The hormone decreases the amount of sugar a liver produces when it is not required.
GLP-1 affects the areas of the brain that control appetite. As a result, you feel less hungry.
As a result, by imitating GLP-1, Wegovy helps you eat less and feel full, which reduces calories and helps you lose weight.
If you thought Wegovy helps you just lose weight, think again. Wegovy is a promising weight loss injection that offers many benefits beyond weight loss. A list follows:
Wegovy has taken the world by storm. Thousands of users have shared their own Wegovy success stories.
One Reddit user shares that Wegovy is, “the answer [they] have been searching for for the last 24 years”.
Yes, it does.
A 68-week study was conducted with 1961 participants. These participants were either obese or overweight with at least one obesity-related medical condition.
Some participants were administered a Wegovy injection along with a reduced-calorie diet and exercise, while others were given a placebo along with diet and exercise.
The average starting weight of both groups was 105 kgs.
The results at the end of the study were as follows:
A separate 2-year study was conducted with 304 obese or overweight participants who had at least one weight-related medical condition.
Some participants were administered a Wegovy injection along with diet and exercise, while others were given a placebo.
At the end of the study:

This shows that Wegovy injection not only helps obese or overweight people lose weight, but also helps them sustain weight loss in the long run.

Wegovy received regulatory approval from the MHRA in 2021 for weight loss treatment. In 2024, the weight loss injection was also approved to prevent cardiovascular events in overweight or obese people.

A study was conducted with 17,604 participants to assess how Wegovy can benefit cardiovascular health in users. The participants were all above 45 years of age and had a BMI of more than 27. They were divided into two groups: Group A was given Wegovy and Group B was given placebo.
At the end of the study, the following was observed:

Take our 2-minute quiz to see if you qualify for treatment.
Injections may look daunting. But that doesn’t mean it is tough to inject yourself with Wegovy.
Wegovy is a once-weekly injection for weight loss. This means, you need to inject Wegovy only once a week, on the same day every week.

Usually, the timing of the injection doesn’t matter. However, taking the injection at the same day, at the same time every week will help you stay consistent - and that is the key to safer, faster weight loss.
Weight loss injections like Wegovy need to be administered carefully. Luckily, the injection pen is quite easy to inject.

Before diving deep into the mechanism of injecting yourself with Wegovy, let us understand what the injection pen consists of. Further, there are a few things to keep in mind before taking the injection.
How to take Wegovy
New dose. New pen
Wegovy comes in a single-use pen, so you must use a fresh injection pen every time you administer a dose.
Preset dose
Wegovy comes in a single-use pen, so you must use a fresh injection pen every time you administer a dose.
A: Expiry date
The expiry date is mentioned on the back of the pen. Check to ensure that Wegovy hasn’t expired.
B: Dosage
Check to make sure that there is enough medicine and dose that your doctor has prescribed.
C: Check pen window
Ensure that Wegovy is clear and colourless. Do not worry if you see air bubbles. They are normal.
D: Needle cover
Before use: The needle will be hidden inside the cover.
After use: The needle cover will lock after use.
E. Pen cap
The pen cap needs to be removed just before you are ready to inject yourself.

Wash your hands well.

Wegovy also has some serious but rare side effects. These include:
These side effects usually subside within a few days to a few weeks. If they do not subside, contact your doctor immediately.

Are you feeling nauseous after taking Wegovy injection? Follow the tips below to handle nausea with ease.
When taking Wegovy, it's important to follow certain safety guidelines. This ensures the medication works effectively and side effects are minimised. Here's some key safety advice:

When you are on Wegovy, some activities will increase the effectiveness of the oral tablet. These activities will keep you in good shape and prevent Wegovy side effects from magnifying. See the infographic below:
Eat a balanced diet. Try foods rich in lean protein, vitamins, and calcium. Limit processed foods, sugary drinks, and too much carbohydrates.
Try to exercise for at least 150 minutes every week. Take a small, brisk walk, jog around the park near your house, go for a swim, or take the bicycle out for a spin—do whatever you enjoy.
Drink plenty of water throughout the day. Hydration is important to tackle the side effects of Wegovy.
If you have diabetes, regularly track your blood sugar levels.
Get at least 8 hours of sleep every night to stay fit and prevent Wegovy's side effects.
Stress is not good for the body. To reduce stress, try yoga, meditation, or relaxation techniques.
Eating a balanced diet is easier said than done. But it is crucial to eat healthy when you are on Wegovy, as a good diet will help you lose weight and retain your muscle mass.

No, Wegovy is not currently available in India.

Karsten Mark Knudsen, CFO and EVP of Novo Nordisk, mentioned in an interview with Business Today that even though the company is “highly vested towards the Indian market,” it won’t be launching Wegovy in India this year. For Knudsen, the demand feels “overwhelming” and that the company “simply cannot manufacture enough compared to the demand in society.”
While the manufacturer hasn’t given an official timeline to launch Wegovy in India, it revealed to Reuters that its goal is to begin supply in India by 2026.
However, many pharmaceutical companies in India, such as Sun Pharma, Cipla, and Lupin are all working to develop different versions of Wegovy.

Wegovy is not currently approved for sale in India. Of course, a grey market exists, where people who can pay large amounts of money can access Wegovy. Some doctors also prescribe the injection off-label.
However, the risks of using Wegovy off-label outweigh its benefits. Taking the injection for weight loss without a prescription or monitoring may land your health in trouble.
It is always better to stick to approved weight loss treatments, so that you can always be in control of your health.
Like Wegovy, there are quite a few weight loss medicines that can help you lose weight. Check out the comparison chart below to understand the alternatives to Wegovy:

To answer the question in one word - yes. Wegovy has been proven to help with drastic weight loss in obese or overweight individuals. This is a ray of hope for scores of obese people who cannot tackle this hormonal condition with diet and exercise alone.

But, as with every other medicine, it is important to note that Wegovy is not a miracle drug that can replace a healthy diet and adequate physical activity for a healthier body. It sure is a means to the end, but it isn’t the end itself.
The path to healthy, sustainable weight loss is complicated, tricky, and exhausting. But Wegovy injection can help. All you need to do is begin.
What should I do if my Wegovy injection pen isn’t working correctly?
If your Wegovy injection pen isn’t working correctly, please contact your doctor immediately. You can also contact the manufacturer Novo Nordisk by visiting Wegovy.com.
Why are there different coloured Wegovy injection pens?
Wegovy injection pens come in five different doses: 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg, 1 mg, 1.7 mg, and 2.4 mg. The pen has five different colours to denote the five different dosages.
Can I change the day or time to take Wegovy injection?

It is recommended that you take the Wegovy injection on the same day and at the same time every week. However, if you would like to change the day and time when you take the Wegovy injection, you can do so two or more days after taking your last Wegovy dose.
Do I have to take Wegovy on an empty stomach?
You can take the Wegovy injection on an empty stomach or after your meal. Both methods are fine. It all depends on your convenience.
I am nervous at the thought of injecting myself with Wegovy injection. What should I do?
It is quite common to feel nervous before taking your Wegovy injection. To calm down, you can watch this video on taking a Wegovy injection or read these simple instructions before you begin.
There is also a programme called ‘WeGo Together’ for Wegovy users. You can join the programme, where a coach will help you navigate the process of taking Wegovy.
Can I travel with Wegovy?
Yes, you can travel with your Wegovy injection pen. However, keep the following things in mind:
How soon will I lose weight with Wegovy?

Every individual is unique. And so is every individual’s weight loss journey. The time it takes for Wegovy to work differs from person to person. To get an accurate response to this question, it is best to contact your doctor, who will be able to guide you through this query.
Is Ozempic a substitute for Wegovy?

Although Wegovy and Ozempic both contain semaglutide, they are different products with different uses and dosages as approved by the FDA. Each medication is safe and effective in its own way. As a result, they are not interchangeable.
Is there a generic version of Wegovy?

Currently, there is no generic version of Wegovy available in the global market. This is because the manufacturer of Wegovy, Novo Nordisk, has patented the medicine until 2026. As a result, other pharmaceutical companies cannot produce or sell generic versions of Wegovy until that time.
If a generic version is available in the grey market, is it okay to use it instead of the actual Wegovy injection?

Novo Nordisk, as the manufacturer of Wegovy, cannot validate the safety and efficacy of any generic version of the injection available in the grey market. As such, it is not advisable to risk your health by using generic or counterfeit medicines for weight loss.

paragraphs: We have sent a passcode to above number. Please enter your code.
Wegovy = weight loss.
Every year, around the world, millions rely on this weekly injection to lose weight and keep it off.
But, the average obese person in India had yet to experience how a shot can dissolve his/her weight loss struggle.
🎉 The wait ended on June 25, 2025, when Danish manufacturer Novo Nordisk officially launched weight loss injection Wegovy in India.
Which means, overweight or obese Indians can now lose weight from the comfort of their homes with this weight loss injection.
If you are struggling with weight loss, Wegovy might be the solution for you. No hard diets. No intensive gym sessions - you can drop your weight with just one injection every week.
In this article, let us dive deep into:
Read on to find out.

After pharmaceutical giant Eli Lilly’s Mounjaro launch in India back in March 2025, global pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk decided to step up its game by capturing the Indian anti-obesity drug market with Wegovy’s launch.
Wegovy will be sold in India as a once-weekly FlexTouch pre-filled injection pen along with four disposable needles, making it easy to use.

Vikram Shrotriya, Managing Director, Novo Nordisk India, shared, “Obesity is not just a personal health concern - it is a chronic disease and a national epidemic that India cannot afford to ignore. We are bringing Wegovy with the convenience of a world-class, state-of-the-art pen device, and an India-specific price.”
Wegovy has already launched in India.
Wegovy is made of semaglutide, which is a GLP-1 receptor agonist. Semaglutide mimics the GLP-1 hormone in the body and does the following:
Releases insulin
The GLP-1 hormone signals the pancreas to release insulin when blood sugar levels rise. This moves sugar into the cells to generate energy.
Slows digestion
The hormone slows down the pace of food movement through the stomach. This results in feeling fuller for longer after eating.
Reduces sugar production in the liver
The hormone decreases sugar production in the liver when it is not required.
Controls appetite
GLP-1 also affects the areas of the brain that control appetite. As a result, you end up feeling less hungry.
All these actions eventually lead to gradual weight loss.
Wegovy does help users lose significant weight.
A 68-week study was conducted with 1961 participants. These participants were either obese or overweight with at least one obesity-related medical condition.
Some participants were administered a Wegovy injection along with a reduced-calorie diet and exercise, while others were given a placebo along with diet and exercise.
The average starting weight of both groups was 105 kg.
The results at the end of the study were as follows:

However, these figures are not set in stone. Depending on various individual factors, such as your starting weight, medical history, and lifestyle habits, your weight loss journey with Wegovy can look different from other people.
Patience, diet, and exercise can go a long way in supporting your weight loss efforts with Wegovy.
Although Wegovy helps people effortlessly lose weight, can any obese or overweight person take the weight loss injection in India?
Wegovy is a prescription-only weight loss injection.
This means you need a doctor’s prescription to take it for weight loss. This also means that your doctor should find it reasonable to prescribe Wegovy to you.
A BMI of:
> 27 kg/m2 with at least one weight-related medical condition, such as:
Inform your doctor if any or all of the following apply to you before taking Wegovy:
In India, Wegovy will be available in the following dosages: 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg, 1 mg, 1.7 mg, 2.4 mg.
This is what a usual Wegovy dosage chart looks like:
Taking the Wegovy injection for weight loss is quite an easy process.
Wegovy is available as FlexTouch, a pre-filled injection pen.
Inside a Wegovy package, you get:
Wegovy is designed to be taken once a week. It is to be taken under the skin (subcutaneously).
Ideal injection sites for Wegovy:
Pro tip:
You can inject Wegovy in the same body part each week, but ensure that you rotate the areas on that particular body part to avoid irritation.
It is advised that you take Wegovy on the same day, at the same time every week.
Wegovy can be self-injected. For first-time users, a healthcare professional can demonstrate how to inject Wegovy.
Every medicine comes with a few side effects. Wegovy is no exception.
Some of the most common Wegovy side effects (occur in more than 1 of 10 people) include:
Common side effects (affecting 1 in 10 people) include:
Wegovy also has some serious but rare side effects. These include:
These side effects usually subside within a few days to a few weeks.
The anti-obesity market in India is on a steep rise. Owing to this, many major international pharmaceutical companies are in the race to dominate the region.
Wegovy isn’t the only weight loss injection available to overweight or obese Indians. Prior to its launch, Eli Lilly entered the market in March 2025 with the weight loss drug Mounjaro.
Here is a clear comparison between Mounjaro and Wegovy so you can choose what’s best for your weight loss goals.
If you are on the fence when it comes to Mounjaro vs Wegovy, check this out:
Looking for an oral alternative to weight loss injections?

Rybelsus, manufactured by Novo Nordisk, is approved in India for type 2 diabetes management, but since it shares the same active ingredient as Wegovy, Rybelsus is also prescribed off-label for weight loss.
Revolutionary weight loss programme: Now available at Aktive
If you are looking for a safe, effective, and sustainable weight loss programme, your search ends at Aktive.
Get your personalised weight loss programme at Aktive, and lose upto 21% of your body weight in 16 months. No restrictive diets. No intense workout schedules.
Just pure weight loss, right from the comfort of your home.
What should I do if my Wegovy injection pen isn’t working correctly?
Please contact your doctor immediately if your Wegovy injection pen isn’t working correctly. You can also contact the manufacturer, Novo Nordisk and request a replacement.
Why are there different coloured Wegovy injection pens?
Wegovy injection pens come in five different colours to denote the five different dosages, such as:
Can I change the day or time to take the Wegovy injection?
Yes, however, it is recommended that you take the Wegovy injection on the same day and at the same time every week.
If you want to change the day and time you take the Wegovy injection, you can do so two or more days after taking your last Wegovy dose.

title: Wegovy Side Effects and How to Manage Them?
meta_description: Nausea, fatigue, or bloating on Wegovy? This guide will explain the common side effects of Wegovy, what’s normal, what’s not, & how to feel better quickly.

h1: How to manage Wegovy side effects?
h2: Key takeaways:
How does Wegovy work in the body?
Why does Wegovy cause side effects?
What are the side effects of taking Wegovy?
Do the side effects go away over time?
How to manage Wegovy side effects?
Why Wegovy affects different people in different ways?
When should you visit the doctor?
To put it briefly
FAQs

paragraphs: We have sent a passcode to above number. Please enter your code.
“Has anyone had horrible side effects on Wegovy?”
A worried Reddit user asked this question.
And if you're here, reading this, chances are you're wondering the same.
You have heard about Wegovy’s weight loss results and seen the before-and-after pictures. Your doctor is endorsing it, too.
It looks promising. But a part of you hesitates.
What if the side effects hit you hard?
What if your body reacts badly to it?
What if the adverse effects are irreversible?
Yes, Wegovy has some side effects.
But this is not the full story. In this guide, we’ll walk you through what those side effects look like, why they happen, and what you can do to feel better.
Mimics natural hormone GLP-1
Slows digestion so you feel fuller for longer
Signals your brain that you’re full
To understand Wegovy’s side effects better, we first need to know what exactly happens when we take the medicine.
Wegovy works by mimicking the actions of a hormone in your body called GLP-1 (glucagon-like peptide-1).
This helps you:
The reason why people experience side effects while on Wegovy is that the body is adjusting to new changes.

GLP-1 receptors are present in the gut, brain, pancreas, heart, kidneys, and blood vessels. When these receptors are activated by Wegovy, they affect how your body digests food, controls hunger, and regulates insulin.
That’s why symptoms like nausea, bloating, or tiredness are common in the beginning. They are signs that your body is shifting gears.
Like any medicine, Wegovy can cause side effects. But not everyone gets them, and most are mild and temporary.
According to the patient information leaflet, here are the side effects you must watch out for:
Very common side effects:
Common side effects:
Uncommon side effects:
They don’t happen as frequently, but are important to know.
These side effects demand prompt medical attention.
Yes, most Wegovy side effects do get better with time. Symptoms like nausea, tiredness, headache, constipation, or diarrhoea are common in the initial days of increasing your dose.
Wegovy side effects are temporary and improve as your body adjusts. In case the side effects persist or worsen over time, please get in touch with your doctor.
Usually, doctors prescribe the lowest dose first and increase gradually. This is to give your body some time to get used to the new medication.
These simple and easy-to-follow tips will help you manage some common Wegovy side effects better:
For nausea:
For vomiting:
For diarrhoea:
For constipation:
For decreased appetite:
For fatigue:
For headaches:
For injection site reactions:
Also read: How to take Wegovy injection for weight loss
You might feel, “Why does Wegovy affect me differently than others?”
You're not imagining it. Sensitivity to a particular medication can be different for everyone.
Some reasons include:
If you feel overwhelmed, talk to your doctor. You might need a slower dose increase, or simply more time to adjust.
Certain conditions or symptoms while on Wegovy may warrant you to visit your doctor as early as possible:
Yes, side effects can be frustrating, but they don't last forever. The long-term goal with Wegovy or any weight loss plan is to help you feel better at a sustainable pace.
And when you stay consistent and ask for help when needed, progress follows.
🎉 Launched in India in June 2025 Wegovy is available in India in the form of pre-filled injection pen (FlexTouch). You can either self-inject it or take it with the help of a healthcare professional.
What medications should you not take with Wegovy?
A drug interaction happens when the presence of one drug affects the actions of the second drug. Wegovy, too, can interact with different medications and supplements.
Some examples include painkillers (NSAIDs), certain antibiotics, antidepressants, and some blood pressure medications.
Also, combining Wegovy with insulin, oral diabetes medications and other GLP-1 (or GIP) agents can cause undesirable effects. Always inform your doctor if you are taking any medications.
Does Wegovy cause hair loss?

Although there is no direct link between hair loss and Wegovy, some people do notice more hair fall after starting on the drug. In a clinical trial[1] involving around 1961 people over 68 weeks, around 2.5 % participants reported hair loss.
That said, most participants recovered while still taking the weight loss treatment with Wegovy.
What happens if you eat too much food on Wegovy?
Wegovy slows down how quickly your stomach empties, so you'll feel full much sooner than usual. So eating past that new 'full point' will increase the chances of gastrointestinal side effects like:
Overeating on Wegovy isn’t dangerous in most cases, but it can be really uncomfortable. If it happens, you may need to eat simple, light meals for some time and visit your doctor.
Which one is safer? Wegovy or Mounjaro?
Both Wegovy and Mounjaro are considered safe when used as prescribed, but they work slightly differently and may suit different people.
Wegovy contains semaglutide, while Mounjaro contains tirzepatide, which targets both GLP-1 and GIP hormones.
Because of this, Mounjaro may cause more gastrointestinal side effects in some users. But it may also offer greater weight loss for others.
As for safety, both come with similar risks:
Can Wegovy cause Ozempic face?

'Ozempic face' refers to the tired or hollow look some people get after losing weight quickly. It manifests in the form of sunken cheeks, looser skin, or more visible wrinkles. It happens because of quick fat loss throughout the body, and especially from the face.
Wegovy, like other GLP-1 meds, can lead to similar changes if weight loss happens too fast. Losing weight gradually while focusing on your diet and exercise can help minimise this.
Can I take a break from Wegovy?

It’s best not to skip doses of Wegovy on purpose. This medication works best when it’s taken consistently every week. Missing a dose can reduce appetite control and bring back side effects when you restart.
If you miss a dose:
If you have missed more than one dose, you should check in with your doctor. They may ask you to go back to a lower dose so you adjust easily.
Can Wegovy cause heart attacks?

There’s no direct evidence that Wegovy causes heart attacks in healthy users. In fact, GLP-1 medications like Wegovy have been shown to reduce the risk of heart disease in people with type 2 diabetes.
However, if you already have a heart condition, your doctor will want to monitor you more closely, especially when you are adjusting to Wegovy during your initial days.
Why am I still so hungry on Wegovy?
Wegovy reduces appetite for most people, but not everyone feels that effect right away. If you’re still hungry:
Who should not use Wegovy?
Wegovy is not recommended for:
Always talk to your doctor before starting Wegovy to make sure it’s a safe fit.
Is it safe to take Wegovy for life?
Wegovy is generally considered safe for long-term use, but ongoing studies are still tracking its effects beyond 2–3 years.

However, like any medication, there are potential risks associated with prolonged use. Possible long-term side effects include pancreatitis, gallbladder disease (such as gallstones or inflammation of the gallbladder), and kidney damage.

If it helps you manage your weight and improve health markers like blood sugar, cholesterol, and blood pressure, your doctor may recommend staying on it long-term and even monitor your health while you are on Wegovy.
What happens if you stop Wegovy?
You may also see a reduction in the side effects from the medication, usually within the first week of stopping.
Although stopping Wegovy is not harmful, it comes with a few changes, like:
If you're thinking of pausing or quitting Wegovy, don’t do it abruptly. Discuss this with your doctor. They may suggest tapering the dose or suggest alternatives that work better for you.
Can Wegovy cause depression?
Although rare, Wegovy might cause or worsen depression and mood changes in some people.

Recent studies [2][3] and adverse event reports have linked semaglutide to higher rates of depression, anxiety, and suicidal thoughts, especially at higher doses or in those with a history of mental health issues.
But in Indian trials or safety monitoring, no statistically significant psychiatric side effects have been reported.
That said, this aspect needs more research. Still, regulatory agencies advise monitoring mental health during treatment, particularly if you or your family has a history of mental health issues.
If you notice new or worsening mood symptoms while on Wegovy, it’s important to speak to your doctor.

The result of a clinical trial published in 2022 with 2539 adults with our treatment and a placebo over 72 weeks.
Up to 80% of weight issues may be influenced by genetics.
Our treatment helps you feel full, so you naturally eat less.
The average diet for women lasts only 4 weeks, for men 6 weeks1.
Our personalised meal plans help you to eat healthy, not to starve yourself and fail.
Studies2 have proven the effectiveness of medication for weight loss.
Just one injection every week can curb your cravings and reduce calorie intake.
Many people struggle with weight loss due to a lack of motivation.
Our team of experts is here to guide and support you every step of the way.
Weight loss specialists
Our team of specialist partner doctors is renowned in the field of weight loss. With their expertise, you can trust that you are receiving the best care possible.

Home delivery
Experience hassle-free, on-time monthly deliveries of your treatment right to your doorstep.
Why is your treatment more effective than other weight loss methods?
Our treatment works on many levels. The active ingredient works by making your body produce more of a specific hormone that affects how hungry you feel.
Increasing these hormone levels slows down digestion and stomach emptying. It affects your appetite because your brain gets the signal "I'm full' much quicker. Which means you eat less.

The medication also resets your metabolism. You have a set point that your body defends to maintain. It gives you hunger signals if you drop below this point. The hormones reset this point to a lower level.
This makes it easier to stick to new eating habits.
What should I go for - weight loss injection or tablet?
At Aktive, we offer both weight loss injections and tablets.

While both forms of weight loss medicines are effective in the long run, what will really work for you depends on your weight loss goals, which form you are most comfortable with, and the efficacy of the medicine.
In the end, it is up to you to decide which form of medicine works best for you. Aktive is here to help you lose weight, no matter what you choose.
I've heard of the Hollywood 'skinny jab' - is this the same?
Yes. The popular term 'skinny jab' refers to treatments. However, while it sounds like it will make you 'skinny', that is not necessarily correct.
It is a prescription medication designed to aid weight loss for health reasons.
Like any prescription medication, our partner doctors will still need to consider your medical history before prescribing it.
How much weight can I lose on your plan?
Clinical trials have demonstrated that our weight loss injection is quite effective. Adults lost an average of 21% of their body weight after 16 months.

However, weight loss is not a linear journey. How much weight you’ll lose on our plan depends on various individual factors such as your starting weight, medical history, regular diet, and exercise schedule.
When do I qualify for your plan?
Our weight loss plan is available on prescription for people who have a body mass index (BMI) of 27 or above.
Some other health issues can prevent our partner doctors from prescribing these medications to you. You can find out if it's safe by taking our quiz. It’s free.
What is BMI?

Body Mass Index (BMI) is a way of calculating your ideal body weight based on your height. When you take our quiz, it will calculate your BMI so you can know if you’re eligible. There are also online tools to calculate your BMI.
Why am I struggling to lose weight?
For some people, eating less and exercising more is not enough. Studies show that your genes can significantly affect how you carry weight. For some people, genetic influence can be as high as 80%.

If you’re not seeing progress, you may want to reevaluate your strategy - and our treatment might be the answer. By feeling full more quickly and for longer, it’s easier to reduce your calorie intake and lose weight successfully.
Do I need to go on a diet?
Following a healthy lifestyle is the best way to get the best results from weight loss treatment. You should reduce the number of calories you consume and eat a healthy, balanced diet.
Our personalised meal plan helps you to avoid eating very fatty and sugary foods, as they are high in calories and lacking in nutrients.
Our fitness plan helps with light exercise, 3 times a week. Both factors will help you get the most out of your weight loss treatment and speed up results.
Why do I need to do the medical consultation?
Our partner doctors review your answers to determine if our weight loss plan is safe for you. As we provide prescription medications, it’s important you answer all questions honestly.
Do I know immediately if I qualify for treatment?

Once you’ve placed your order, our partner doctors review your medical history. If they have additional questions, we'll contact you via email. We will not take payment unless you qualify and we can send you the treatment.
What's included in the weight loss subscription plan?

Our subscription includes a delivery service every 4 weeks, with each package containing 4 weeks of treatment. Our partner doctors will check your health every month and monitor your progress. Our plans also include support from a nutritionist and health coach. This way, we can give you the support you need. Our plans are all-inclusive: treatment, free delivery, personalised meal plan, fitness plan and support from our weight loss specialists.
Will you monitor my health and progress?
Yes, our partner doctors will ask you to update your health information before each delivery. This way, they can monitor how you are doing and give you additional advice if needed.

Aktive is a digital platform that connects users with registered healthcare professionals and licensed pharmacies. Aktive does not provide medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment, nor does it dispense medications. All medical consultations, clinical decisions, and prescriptions are made solely by the independent doctors using the platform. The supply and dispensing of any prescribed medication are carried out by third-party, registered pharmacies.
Treatment should be taken alongside a healthy diet and lifestyle. Because everybody is different, individual results vary and depend on lifestyle.
The information on our website is based on clinical results. You can read the studies below.

title: The Best 5 Yoga Poses For Weight Loss To Try At Home
meta_description: Want to lose weight without wasting time and money? Try these 5 simple yoga poses (or yogasanas) for weight loss from the comfort of your home.

h1: 5 simple yoga poses for weight loss at home
h2: Key takeaways:
1. Boat pose (Naukasana / Navasana)
2. Warrior pose 2 (Virabhadrasana 2)
3. Plank pose (Phalakasana)
4. Bridge pose (Setu bandhasana)
5. Sun salutation (Surya namaskar)
The art of yoga - What experts have to say
Beyond yoga for weight loss
It’s time to roll the mat.
FAQs
h3: How does naukasana help with weight loss?
How many rounds of naukasana should I do for weight loss?
How does virabhadrasana 2 help with weight loss?
How many rounds of virabhadrasana 2 should I do for weight loss?
How does phalakasana help with weight loss?
How many rounds of phalakasana should I do for weight loss?
How does setu bandhasana help with weight loss?
How many rounds of setu bandhasana should I do for weight loss?

paragraphs: We have sent a passcode to above number. Please enter your code.
Caught up in your daily routine and struggling to find some time for your health?
It’s time to give your body the care it deserves.
Read on to find out how you can lose weight with 5 simple yoga poses in your safe space, your home.
Yoga is one of the easiest, most affordable ways to lose weight at home—no expensive memberships, no commute, and no fancy equipment!
Let’s say it out loud, we all have 24 hours, but not everyone has the same kind of time! Except for a lucky few, life is super busy for most of us.
Between juggling work, family, and the occasional binge-watching session, finding time (or budget) for working out in fancy gyms may feel impossible.
What if we say all you need to lose weight is a mat, a small towel, and a clean room with fresh air?
Whether you have 10 minutes in the morning or can spare some time before bed, these poses help melt fat and tone your body!
From busy moms to 9-to-5 hustlers, these five yoga poses can fit into any routine.
In Indian spirituality, a boat is often a sign of a new journey, transition, or crossing from one state of being to another.
A boat symbolizes a major transition in life. Just like that, the boat pose, also called the naukasana/navasana can be a turning point in your fitness journey.
If you are just starting, try 2–3 rounds per session - hold 10 seconds at each round.
Repeat 3-5 times every week.
Gradually increase your repetitions by 1 round every week.
Pro tip:
New to the boat pose? Keep your knees bent to reduce the pressure on your abs. Place a yoga strap under the soles of your feet and hold the ends to maintain better balance.
Virabhadrasana has its roots in Hindu mythology.
This yoga pose is named after the fierce warrior Virabhadra, who was born from the fallen locks of Lord Shiva.
Like the warrior, this pose represents determination, strength and focus.
It is a great way to improve balance and stamina while working on the hips, thighs, legs, and shoulders.
The yoga pose still holds its place in the modern-day world that’s obsessed with fitness.
In 2019, 1011 people at the Japan Auction House achieved the amazing feat of performing the virabhadrasana 2 at the same time, and setting a Guinness World Record!
Beginners can start with 3-5 rounds every session, for 3-4 times a week.
Increase 1-2 rounds as and when you feel comfortable.
Pro tip:
If you’re doing this pose for the first time, start with your feet closer together. Use a wall for support. Place a chair under your bent leg.
Do push-ups seem too tough? How about trying the plank pose? It’s simpler, offers the same benefits as a push-up, and allows you to be still.
Truly, the phalakasana, also known as the plank pose, is one of the best home workouts for weight loss and full-body strength.
Want to know what practising stillness can do for you over time? Read on.
Start with 3-5 repetitions in a session and practice for 4-5 days a week.
Pro tip:
New to phalakasana ? Try the wall plank, where you stand and press your hands against a wall. Bring your feet back slightly to create an angled plank position.
Feeling guilty for spending all day sitting at your desk job? The bridge pose (setu bandhasana) is exactly what you need.
This asana massages your stiff knees and shoulders by stretching them just right.
It also calms your mind[1] from anxiety, stress and even sleeplessness.
But wait, there's more!
You can start with 5-8 rounds in a session for 3-4 times a week.
Increase repetitions as your strength and flexibility increase.
Pro tip:
Use a blanket under the shoulders/neck and place your feet close to the wall for extra stability. Raise your shoulders gently if you have neck/shoulder pain.
Did you know that the surya namaskar is a 5000-year-old Indian practice that strengthens your body, sharpens your mind, and connects you to nature?
It is powerful. It is dynamic. And it engages your arms, core, back, and legs. Doing these 12 poses every day is one of the fastest ways to burn calories without stepping into a gym.
Looking for step-by-step instructions to master the best beginner-friendly surya namaskar and lose weight?
A TED-Ed video shares some interesting insights on what yoga does to the body. The video, narrated by Krishna Sudhir, explains why yoga is quintessential for good health. He shares:
“Twisting your body into yoga’s physical postures stretches multiple muscle groups….Frequent stretching also improves your pain tolerance for feats of flexibility.
Adding yoga to an existing exercise routine can improve strength and flexibility for hard-to-treat conditions like chronic lower back pain, rheumatoid arthritis, and osteoporosis.
The breathing exercises like those found in yoga relax the muscles that constrict the airway and improve oxygen diffusion.”

The best kind of fitness is the one that improves your physical, mental, and emotional health. This is why, even if you practise yoga daily, here are a few more things you can do to maximise its benefits.
Then, fitness is yours!
However, weight loss can be challenging sometimes and needs a tailor-made approach.

If you are having trouble losing weight despite following your fitness routine thoroughly, Aktive’s weight loss programme is here to help. Lose up to 15% of body weight within a year with Aktive’s customised fitness plans and expert advice.
And now, we begin!
Be it a super busy day, these yoga poses are simple enough to fit into your daily plans. They not only help you lose weight but offer much more.
Yoga helps build strength and increase endurance, so your body burns calories even when you’re resting!
Yoga helps regulate appetite and prevents you from unnecessarily bingeing on food.
Yoga is also great for stress relief. It helps lower cortisol levels, which helps dissolve stubborn belly fat.
So, no more excuses! Roll out that mat and start today. Five minutes, fifteen minutes—every pose takes you closer to your fitness goals.
Kyunki ab yoga hai, to fitness mumkin hai.
Can I practice these poses during pregnancy?
Yes, you can do most yoga asanas during the first three months of pregnancy, like standing poses and gentle forward bends. But you may need to modify them afterwards.
Just be sure to keep the movements mild and avoid any pressure on your tummy.
Poses like the bound angle pose (baddha konasana) are great throughout the pregnancy, as they strengthen your pelvic muscles and can help ease labour.
Note: Always do these exercises under supervision and consult your doctor before you try out any new pose.
How do these poses compare to traditional cardio for weight loss?
While these poses may not burn as many calories as an intense cardio session would, they can help you build lean muscle and improve metabolism.
All these factors are important to lose and maintain weight in the long run. Mix yoga with cardio, strength training and a healthy diet.
Is it normal to feel dizzy during or after these poses?
It’s ok to feel a little dizzy, especially while doing setu-bandhasana or surya namaskar, as these poses can affect the blood flow to the brain.
Try moving slowly between poses and sip some water in between.
If dizziness persists, consult a doctor.
Can I combine these poses with other exercises?
Definitely. Yoga is a good complement to other exercises.
You could do cardio or strength training on some days and the above-mentioned yoga poses on other days.
Or leverage the flexibility yoga gives and use these poses as a warm-up or cool-down for other workouts.
How do I breathe during these poses?
A good rule of thumb here is to inhale when you're opening your chest or lifting.
Similarly, exhale when you do any folding or twisting movement.
In poses like plank pose (phalakasana) and boat pose (naukasana), just focus on maintaining steady breaths.
With sun salutation (surya namaskar), each movement follows a specific breathing pattern. Most importantly, don’t hold your breath for too long at any time.
How often should I practice these poses for weight loss?
You can start with fewer sessions and gradually increase the weekly frequency as you feel comfortable.
It is good to do it anywhere from 3 to 5 times a week, with each session lasting 20 to 30 minutes.
How long will it take to see weight loss results from these poses?
With consistent practice and a healthy diet, you may notice changes in a month or two.
However, these results can be different for different people. Focus on inch loss rather than the numbers on the weighing scale.
Is it better to do these poses in the morning or evening?
Both times have their benefits. In the morning, your mind is fresh and alert, but the body might feel a bit stiff. This may make the poses more challenging.
In the evening, your body is more flexible, which makes it easier to flow through the asanas. Plus, it's a nice way to unwind and destress.
You can also bend your hips forward while sitting and try touching your feet (Paschimottanasana or seated forward bend) for this.
It really depends on what feels best for you.
How do I stay motivated to practice yoga regularly?
We understand. It may be difficult to stay on track at first. But here are some tips you can try:
Can I practice these poses during periods?
It’s usually best to avoid most yoga poses during this time.
But if your flow is heavier than normal, poses like seated angle pose (upavistha konasana), bound angle pose (baddha konasana), and hero pose (virasana) are gentle and ease discomfort.
Just remember, no headstands or anything like shoulder stands (Sarvangasana) should be done during this time.
Listen to your body, and do what feels comfortable.
About the author:
Gauri Ghatnekar-Desai holds a PG Diploma in Emergency Medical Services from Symbiosis Institute of Health Sciences, Pune.
As a professional healthcare writer, she creates simple, accurate, detail-oriented content for health organisations, healthcare providers, and patients.
Beyond the desk, she enjoys reading, travelling, and adventure sports.

title: 9 Zero-Calorie Foods for Weight Loss
meta_description: Discover 9 low-calorie foods that keep you full longer. From cucumber to bell peppers, learn which foods support weight loss without counting every calorie.

h1: 9 almost zero-calorie foods that’ll help you lose weight
h2: Key takeaways
What are zero-calorie or low-calorie foods?
Why do we need zero-calorie or low-calorie foods?
9 best low-calorie foods to try for weight loss
How to eat low-calorie foods smartly?
FAQs

paragraphs: We have sent a passcode to above number. Please enter your code.
Zero-calorie foods. Sounds like a dream, doesn't it?
But here’s the thing…except for plain water, no food is truly calorie-free.
But that doesn't mean you cannot find healthy, low-calorie foods in your kitchen.
If you're trying to eat lighter without feeling starved, these low-calorie foods deserve a permanent place on your plate.

Read this list to discover everyday foods that are low in calories and are readily available at your local vegetable market. Nothing fancy, nothing gourmet, nothing pricey. It’s affordable and accessible.
So, are you ready to discover a more innovative way to stay healthy?
First things first: no fruit, vegetable, or dish is truly "zero calorie." The only real zero-calorie ingredient is plain water.
So, what are low-calorie foods?
There isn't a fixed definition, but here’s a general idea.
Low-calorie foods, as the name suggests, are foods that contain very few calories per serving. They can add volume, fibre, or water to your meal.
If images of a cucumber or a watermelon are floating in your mind, you are on the right track.
You can eat these foods in larger quantities and still fulfil your daily calorie goals.
However, keep in mind that these foods do not help you burn fat on their own. They only support weight loss when consumed as part of a healthy, balanced diet.
Basically, low-calorie foods make you feel full and don’t add up much to your daily calorie intake, so you eat well and don’t crave more food.
We have all grown up with the idea that when we eat less, we lose more weight.
However, the truth is that when we starve ourselves, we end up feeling hungrier, more tired, and more prone to cravings. And that isn't sustainable.
Here's why eating low-calorie foods is a wise choice:
Without much ado, let’s see which low-calorie foods we need to add to our diet.
1. Cucumber (Kheera)
Calories: Approx. 10 calories per 100g

Crisp, cooling, and made up of over 95% water, kheera is a classic Indian summer staple. It also contains small amounts of potassium and vitamin K, which makes it a great option for hydration and mild electrolyte support.
Did you know?
Cucumber has been cultivated for over 3,000 years. It was even used in ancient Indian and Egyptian cultures as a cooling remedy!
How to add it to your diet:
2. Spinach (Palak)
Calories: Approx. 22-28 calories per 100g
The bright green foliage of palak is a powerhouse of iron, folate, and vitamin A.
Popeye’s favourite food adds bulk, fibre, and colour to your plate, nourishing you well.
How to add it to your diet:
3. Zucchini (Courgette)
Calories: Approx. 16-19 calories per 100g.

Light, juicy, and mild in taste, zucchini is a vegetable that is steadily growing in popularity across India. It is rich in antioxidants (like lutein and zeaxanthin), folate, potassium, vitamin C, and fibre. It has nearly 95% water, and almost no fat!
The best part is that zucchini can easily be incorporated into Indian dishes, making it perfect for days when you want to eat more volume but stay within your calorie limit.
How to add it to your diet:
4. Mushrooms (Khumb/Khumbi/Kukurmutta)
Calories: Approx. 25-31 calories per 100g
Earthy, chewy, and surprisingly filling, mushrooms are rich in B vitamins, selenium, and antioxidants.
Interestingly, when exposed to sunlight, they’re also one of the rare vegetarian sources of vitamin D!
How to add it to your diet:

Most of the vegetables mentioned above pair well with grilled or raw paneer. With just the right amount of protein and calories in 100g paneer, this white delight can cover a huge portion of your daily protein needs.
5. Watermelon (Tarbuj)
Calories: Approx. 30 calories per 100g
If there’s something that makes water blush red, it’s watermelon. It is over 90% water, naturally sweet, and just what your body craves on a hot day.
It’s also a source of vitamin C and lycopene (a powerful antioxidant).
Watermelon is technically both a fruit and a vegetable, since it belongs to the cucumber family.
How to add it to your diet:
6. Strawberries (Jharber/Hisalu)
Calories: Approx. 33-36 calories per 100g
Juicy, tangy-sweet, and rich in antioxidants, strawberries are a great source of vitamin C and manganese. Each berry holds almost 200 seeds on the outside!
How to add it to your diet:
7. Unsweetened lemon water (Nimbu pani)
Calories: Approx. 15 calories per 100g lemon
Lemon water is that easy, everyday habit that reduces your cravings, improves digestion, and adds vitamin C with every sip.
In ancient Rome, lemons were so prized that they were considered a symbol of luxury!
How to add it to your diet:
Short on time and looking for a light yet filling breakfast? A veggie-loaded poha with peanuts and a squeeze of lemon is the perfect low-calorie breakfast.
Read: Here's how you can enjoy poha smartly for weight loss.
8. Unsweetened green tea
Calories: Approx. 3 calories per cup (236.5ml)
Green tea has become a ritual for many during tea breaks. This is thanks to its light taste and antioxidant content. It is rich in catechins, which work as a metabolism booster.
Bonus? You can steep the same leaves 2–3 times and enjoy your tea multiple times.
How to add it to your diet:
Try these 7 best Indian homemade drinks for weight loss to stay refreshed and energised without overloading on calories.
9. Bell peppers (Shimla mirch)
Calories: Approx. 17 calories per 100g
Crunchy and colourful, bell peppers are a good choice if you are looking to add volume without the calories.
Red and yellow peppers have the most antioxidants, while green ones offer a slightly earthy, traditional flavour.
Bell peppers are a good source of fibre, vitamins A & C, and have a low glycaemic index. This makes them ideal for keeping you full and managing cravings.
They are easy to cook and make Indian, Asian or continental dishes yummier.
How to add it to your diet:
A spicy bonus
Who said spices can’t have fun? Eating healthy does not mean your food should taste bland. So let’s open that masala-dani and elevate the taste.
P.S. These spices are also sure to support your weight loss efforts.
You’ve got your hand on a low-calorie food. But the trick lies in eating them smartly. Here’s what you can do to consume your low-calorie foods more effectively.
Weight loss doesn't mean starving yourself. When you focus on the right foods in the right combinations, your meals can be both delicious and healthy.
Traditional low-calorie foods can absolutely support your weight loss plans. You simply need to know how to use them wisely.
Eating a healthy diet is one aspect of weight loss. But a structured approach that prioritises your food habits, movement, and recovery can make all the difference.
If you are looking for a weight loss plan that actually works for you, try Aktive.
How many calories should I eat daily?
Your daily calorie intake depends on several factors, including age, weight, activity level, and your specific fitness goals.
Typically, it is recommended that women consume between 1,200 -1,600 calories per day, while men may need 1,500 -1,800 calories.
However, instead of worrying about numbers, you can manage your calorie intake by creating balanced meals and monitoring your portions.
Adding more foods that are high in water and fibre can reduce your hunger and keep you full for longer.
Can I eat more if I eat low-calorie foods?
Yes. That’s the beauty of it.
Low-calorie, high-volume foods like lauki, cucumber, spinach, and clear soups allow you to eat more food and feel full, all while staying within your calorie target.
However, a diet consisting exclusively of low-calorie foods may not keep you full or provide sufficient nutrition.
For this reason, you will need to balance your meals with a combination of protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats.
Can I eat these low-calorie foods every day?
Yes, you can.
Vegetables like kheera, spinach, lauki, and mushrooms are meant for daily eating. They are light, hydrating, and full of fibre and micronutrients.
Just keep variety in your meals and pair these vegetables with protein (such as dal, paneer, or curd) and healthy carbs like multigrain roti or brown rice. That is enough for balanced nutrition.
Are low-calorie foods enough for nutrition, or do I need supplements?
Low-calorie foods are great, but they are not enough on their own.
Vegetables and fruits can give you fibre and micronutrients, but they are low in protein and healthy fats. These are two things your body needs every day.
Every meal should include:
If you eat a varied Indian diet that covers all food groups, supplements are usually not needed unless you have a specific deficiency.
However, if you are severely restricting calories or avoiding entire food groups, consult your doctor to determine if you may need vitamin B12, vitamin D, iron, or calcium supplements.
What are empty-calorie foods?
These are foods that provide calories but are low in nutrients. Some examples are:
They often sneak into the diet through chai-time cravings or during celebrations/festivities. To cut down their intake, you can replace them with whole foods or roasted snacks.
What are negative-calorie foods?
Negative-calorie foods are a myth.
Even low-calorie foods like lauki, tomatoes, palak, or mushrooms do not make your body burn more calories than they contain. The thermic effect of food is too small for that.
For a food to become “negative,” your body would need to burn more than 100 percent of its calories during digestion, which is impossible. Therefore, the concept lacks scientific backing.
What is volume eating?
Volume eating means consuming more foods that have a high bulk (due to fibre or water), but very few calories.
This includes raw veggies, leafy greens, clear soups, and fruits with high water content. It helps you eat more, feel full, and still stay within your calorie limit.

Can I drink lemon water multiple times a day for faster weight loss?
You can have plain lemon water 2–3 times a day if it suits your digestion.
Although it doesn’t directly melt fat, it reduces bloating and helps control your appetite. It also keeps you hydrated.
Lemon water is a good replacement for sugary chai or juices. But overdoing it can be harmful to your digestion and teeth.
Why am I not losing weight even with low-calorie foods?
Eating low-calorie foods is a key aspect of weight loss.
However, a variety of factors also have an impact on weight loss, such as:
In fact, starving yourself or not consuming enough protein can trigger your body into survival mode, making it even more challenging to lose weight.
Is your diet low-calorie but not protein-rich? Explore our 7-day protein-rich diet plan for weight loss, pair it with low-calorie foods, and watch the magic happen.
If the scale isn’t moving despite your efforts, consider consulting a dietitian to identify any nutritional gaps or underlying issues.
Do I need to count calories if I eat these low-calorie foods?
Not really, but a little awareness can be helpful.
Low-calorie, high-volume foods naturally stop you from overeating because they fill you up quickly. If half your plate is vegetables like kheera, palak, or lauki, you are already on the right path.
What you still need to watch out for are the calorie-dense foods.
Excessive oil consumption while cooking or overeating dry fruits or paneer, because they are considered "healthy", can add up faster than you think.
So start with portion control and good food choices instead of counting every calorie.
If your weight loss slows down, tracking your food intake for a week or two can help identify hidden calories.
Should I avoid rice altogether if I want to lose weight?
Not at all.
It’s about quantity and what you eat with it. Instead of a full plate, try half a katori of rice with sabzi, dal, and salad.
Swap regular white rice with brown rice, red rice, poha, daliya, or millet varieties for more fibre.
